bill_title: grant counties greater authority to prohibit the use of fireworks during periods of extreme fire danger.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to grant counties greater authority to prohibit the use of fireworks during periods of extreme fire danger. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 34-37-19 be amended to read as follows: 34-37-19. Any county may, by resolution, regulate or prohibit the use of fireworks outside the boundaries of any municipality in those areas where the fire danger, as determined by use of the rangeland fire index as established by rule promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26 , by the secretary of agriculture or his designee , has reached the extreme category in that county for two consecutive days during the period from June twentieth through June twenty-seventh to July fourth, inclusive . 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

bill_versions.bill_version: Senate Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to grant counties greater authority to prohibit the use of fireworks during periods of extreme fire danger. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 34-37-19 be amended to read as follows: 34-37-19. Any county may, by resolution, regulate or prohibit the use of fireworks outside the boundaries of any municipality in those areas where the fire danger, as determined by use of the rangeland fire index as established by rule promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26 , by the secretary of agriculture or his designee , has reached the extreme category in that county for two consecutive days during the period from June twentieth through June twenty-seventh to July fifth, inclusive . 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

bill_versions.bill_version: House Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to grant counties greater authority to prohibit the use of fireworks during periods of extreme fire danger. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 34-37-19 be amended to read as follows: 34-37-19. Any county may, by resolution, regulate or prohibit the use of fireworks , other than fountains, ground spinners, toy novelties, sparklers, and smoke items, outside the boundaries of any municipality in those areas where the fire danger, as determined by use of the rangeland fire index as established by rule promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26 , by the secretary of agriculture or his designee , has reached the extreme category in that county for two consecutive days during the period from June twentieth through June twenty-seventh to July fifth, inclusive. During such period, the county's action is suspended if the rangeland fire index falls below the very high category and shall again become effective if the rangeland fire index reaches the extreme category . 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to grant counties greater authority to prohibit the use of fireworks during periods of extreme fire danger. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 34-37-19 be amended to read as follows: 34-37-19. Any county may, by resolution, regulate or prohibit the use of fireworks outside the boundaries of any municipality in those areas where the fire danger, as determined by use of the rangeland fire index as established by rule promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26 , by the secretary of agriculture or his designee , has reached the extreme category in that county for two consecutive days during the period from June twentieth through June twenty-seventh to July fifth, inclusive. During such period, the county's action is suspended if the rangeland fire index falls below the very high category and shall again become effective if the rangeland fire index reaches the extreme category . 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to grant counties greater authority to prohibit the use of fireworks during periods of extreme fire danger. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 34-37-19 be amended to read as follows: 34-37-19. Any county may, by resolution, regulate or prohibit the use of fireworks outside the boundaries of any municipality in those areas where the fire danger, as determined by use of the rangeland fire index as established by rule promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26 , by the secretary of agriculture or his designee , has reached the extreme category in that county for two consecutive days during the period from June twentieth through June twenty-seventh to July second, inclusive. During such period, the county's action is suspended if the rangeland fire index falls below the very high category and shall again become effective if the rangeland fire index reaches the extreme category . 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
